intro: Lepidaploa trinitatis, commonly known as the Trinidadian starleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Trinidad. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the rainy season. Lepidaploa trinitatis is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky crevices. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
